oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter announcing his promotion to sergeant
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page letter handwritten letter by Christopher Ammons to his family that announces his promotion to sergeant. He describes his fourth visit to Song Be for another seven-day search-and-destroy mission that ended with the discovery of numerous Viet-Cong stores. Some of the supplies were U. S. aid, and he expresses his anger that we were accidentally funding Viet-Cong operations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; War casualties; Bunkers (Fortification); Promotions, Military; Foreign aid program; Song Be (Vietnam: Province); Search & destroy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
